alert.note: Alert for Middlesex (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 10:07PM EST until January 10 at 1:45PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of New Jersey, including the following counties, Hunterdon, Mercer, Middlesex, Morris, Somerset and Warren and Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Bucks, Lehigh and Northampton. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1004 PM EST, local law enforcement reported numerous road closures as an area of very heavy rainfall continues across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - For Monocacy Creek at Bethlehem: At 9:45pm the stage was 4.51 feet and rising. Flood Stage is 4.5 feet. For Neshanic at Reaville: At 9:30pm the stage was 9.66 feet and rising. Flood Stage is 6.5 feet. For South Branch Raritan River at Stanton: At 9:45pm the stage was 8.17 feet and rising. Flood Stage is 8 feet. For Musconetcong River at Bloomsbury: At 10:00pm the stage was 6.17 feet and rising. Flood Stage is 6 feet. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
